unique_questions.statement:
Match the following rivers with their tributaries.
 A: i-a,ii-b, iii-c, iv-d  B: i-c,ii-d, iii-a, iv-b C: i-d,ii-b, iii-c, iv-a D: i-a,ii-d, iii-c, iv-b

Which of the following is NOT an example of major industrial regions of India?
 A: Gujarat region
 B: Hugli region
 C: Chota Nagpur region
 D: Northern Malabar region
Which among the following is NOT a Raster File format? A: ECW B: BMP C: TIFF D: SVG

Which one of the following may be the true characteristic of cyclones? A: Temperate cyclones move from west to east with westerlies whereas tropical cyclones follow trade winds. B: The front side of cyclone is known as the 'eye of cyclone'. C: Cyclones possess a centre of high pressure surrounded by closed isobars. D: Hurricanes are well-knonw tropical cyclones which develop over mid-latitudes.

Identify the incorrect pair from the given options.
 A: Human ecology - H. H. Barrows
 B: Ecosystem - A. G. Tansley
 C: Ecology - Ernst Haeckel
 D: 10% Law - Neil Smith
In the Quadrantal bearing system of Prismatic Compass the bearings run from ______. A: 00 - 1800 B: 00 - 3600 C: 900 - 1800 D: 00 - 900

________ is done in cases in which the plane tabler is asked to show a few more objects in between the objects already shown on a map. A: Intersection B: Interaction C: Proportional Distribution D: Resection

Does your village has piped drinking water supply?
This is an example of which of the following scale type of statistical mesurement.
 A: Nominal B: Ordinal C: Interval D: Ratio
Which of the following waveband can be used to discriminate among clouds, snow and ice? A: Green B: Mid-infrared C: Near-infrared D: Thermal-infrared

Arrange the following layers of Heterosphere in ascending order in terms of their respective heights -
(A) Atomic Hydrogen
(B) Molecular Nitrogen
(C) Helium
(D) Atomic Oxygen 
 A: A, D, C, B B: B, D, A, C C: A, C, B, D D: B, D, C, A
Which of the following marine mammals is a herbivore? A: Sea cow B: seal fish C: Sea lions D: Hippopotamus

Geopolitically Israel is located in _______.
 A: Geographical Pivot
 B: Rimland
 C: Heartland
 D: Outer Crescent
Which is the leading producing state of Rubber?  A: Karnataka B: Kerala C: Tamil Nadu D: Telangana
Which type of signals are transmitted by GPS satellites?  A: Radio signals B: Thermal Infrared signals C: Near Infrared signals D: 0.6 to 0.7 micrometre wavelength radiation

Contour interval selected is A: directly proportional to flatness of ground B: larger if the purpose of contouring is for earthwork calculation C: inversely proportional to the scale of map D: directly proportional to time and fund available

Match List-I of scholars with their respective titles in List-II and select the correct answer from the given alternatives.
 A: a - i, b - ii, c - iii, d - iv
 B: a - iii, b - i, c - iv, d - ii
 C: a - ii, b - i, c - iv, d - iii
 D: a - i, b - iv, c - ii, d - iii

Mahogany, Rosewood are trees of which biomes?
 A: Mediterranean biomes
 B: Tropical rainforest biomes
 C: Monsoon biomes
 D: Taiga biomes
The Mahi River discharges its water into which body of water? A: Arabian Sea B: Bay of Bengal C: Gulf of Khambat D: Ganges

Match the (List-I cities) with (List-II temperature) characteristics: and chose your answer the code below.
 A: a - iv, b - iii, c - ii, d - i
 B: a - ii, b - iii, c - i, d - iv
 C: a - iii, b - i, c - ii, d - iv
 D: a - iii, b - ii, c - i, d - iv
In 2022, the world's leading importer in merchandise trade was _______ . A: China B: Germany C: USA D: Japan

Identify the correct statements about regional planning and development in India.
(A). The Hill Area Development Programme (HADP) was initiated in the Fifth Five Year Plan.
(B). The National Rural Employment Programme (NREP) was first implemented in the Sixth Five Year Plan.
(C). The Rashtriya Sam Vikas Yojana (RSVY) was initiated in 2014-15 to develop backward areas.
(D). Aspirational districts are assessed under 5 broad socio-economic themes.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) and (B) only. B: (A), (B) and (C) only C: (A), (B) and (D) only. D: (B), (C) and (D) only.
In contouring, the existence of a ______ surface is assumed. A: Plain B: Undulated C: Uneven D: Statistical
________ Gunter's chains equal 1 mile in Chain Surveying. A: 10 B: 80 C: 20 D: 30

Choose the correct one from the given statements.
1. There are four varieties of coal, among which Anthracite is called hard coal
2. Bituminous is the most commonly used type of coal for electricity generation
3. Lignite has a high heating value and a low moisture content
 A: All are correct
 B: 1 and 2
 C: 2 an d3
 D: 1 and 3

List the sequence of features in order of their occurrence from the depths to the coast:
 A: Continental Shelf, Continental Slope, Deep Sea Plain, Oceanic Deeps
 B: Continental Slope, Oceanic Deeps, Continental Shelf, Deep Sea Plain
 C: Oceanic Deeps, Deep Sea Plain, Continental Slope, Continental Shelf
 D: Deep Sea Plain, Oceanic Deeps, Continental Shelf, Continental Slope

Which of the following statements(s) concerning natural regions of the world is/are correct?
1) Equatorial climatic regions have less urbanization
2) Mediterranean climatic regions have a high level of urbanization
3) Equatorial climatic regions have a high concentration of human population
4) Mediterranean climatic regions practice plantation farming
Select the correct answer using the code given below:
 A: 1 and 2 only  B: 1, 2 and 3 C: 1, 2 and 4 D: 1 only
Which of the following is called the Age of Fishes? A: Devonian B: Carboniferous C: Jurassic D: Pleistocene

Match the following:
 A: a-I, b-II, c-III, d-IV
 B: a-III, b-I, c-IV, d-II
 C: a-IV, b-I, c-III, d-II
 D: a-II, b-III, c-IV, d-I

A relatively fixed point of known elevation above datum is called ___________.
 A: bench mark
 B: datum point
 C: reduced level
 D: reference point
Dynamic concept of monsoon was proposed by A: Hally B: Frost C: Flohn D: Koteswaram
Which of the following (Industry - Location) is not correctly matched ? A: Cotton Textile - Ramnathpuram B: Ship Building - Vishakhapattnam C: Petro Chemical- Patiala  D: Jute - Birlapur

Who among the following contributed in the development of Post modernism in Geography?
 A: W.L. Garrison
 B: J. Blaut
 C: Carl Ritter
 D: Edward Soja

Consider the following statements regarding Migration.
1. Net migration is the total change in the number of in-migrants and out-migrants.
2. As per the 2011 census, Delhi and Mumbai are migrant magnets.
3. Higher employment opportunities are one of the Push factors of migration.
How many of the above statements is/are correct?
 A: 1
 B: 2
 C: 3
 D: None

Noctilucent clouds are found in which sphere of the atmosphere ?
 A: Troposphere
 B: Stratosphere
 C: Mesosphere
 D: Ionosphere

Which of the following statement regarding the Deccan Plateau is correct?
 A: The Deccan Plateau has almost the same height through its expanse.
 B: The Deccan Plateau is higher on the east and west ends and slopes towards the center.
 C: The Deccan Plateau is higher in the west and slopes gently eastwards.
 D: The Deccan Plateau is higher in the east and slopes gently westwards.
Quartzite is a metamorphised form of _______ A: Sandstone B: Shale C: Slate D: Marble
The point of origin of an earthquake is called ________. A: Epicenter  B: Hot spot C: Focus D: Median Point
An oval-shaped mound composed of glacial drift is called ________. A: Esker B: Drumlin C: Kame D: Moraine
The difference of observed mean temperature of a place and mean temperature of its latitude is called _______ A: Temperature Inversion B: Negative Lapse Rate C: Thermal Anomaly D: Normal Lapse Rate
The Southern Oscillation Index is measured as the pressure difference between Darwin and ______ A: Tahiti B: Peru C: Chile D: Columbia

Match List - I with List - II

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) - (II), (B) - (IV), (C) - (III), (D) - (I)
 B: (A) - (I), (B) - (IV), (C) - (III), (D) - (II)
 C: (A) - (III), (B) - (I), (C) - (II), (D) - (IV)
 D: (A) - (II), (B) - (III), (C) - (IV), (D) - (I)

Consider the following statements regarding the laterite soils of India:
1. Laterite soils are generally red in colour.
2. Laterite soils are rich in nitrogen and potash.
3. Laterite soils are well-developed in Rajasthan and UP.
4. Tapioca and cashew nuts grow well in this soil.
Which of the statements given above is /are correct?
 A: 1 only
 B: 2, 3 and 4
 C: 1 and 4 only
 D: 1, 2 and 4

Arrange the following states in ascending order on the basis of percentage of tribal population (2011):
(A) Madhya Pradesh
(B) Maharashtra
(C) Rajasthan
(D) Meghalaya
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A), (B), (C), (D)
 B: (C), (D), (B), (A)
 C: (B), (C), (A), (D)
 D: (D), (A), (B), (C)

In soil horizon, C layer represents ________.
 A: Organic debris
 B: Weathered parent material 
 C: Maximum silicate clay material
 D: Consolidated rock

Statement 1: India's external trade composition has shifted from primary goods to manufactured goods.
Statement 2: Most of India's external trade is conducted with African countries.
 A: Both statements are true. B: Both statements are false. C: Statement 1 is true, Statement 2 is false. D: Statement 1 is false, Statement 2 is true.

Which of the following is not true about globalization and its impact on India? A: It has expanded trade in goods and services. B: It has led to greater flow of Foreign Direct Investment. C: Increase in exports is greater than increase in imports. D: None of the above
Nomothetic approach in geography emphasizes upon A: Empirical study B: Inductive study C: Law making study D: Ideographic study
Which phase comes before a paradigm shift according to Thomas Kuhn? A: Pre-paradigm phase B: Crisis phase C: Post-paradigm phase D: Normal science phase

Consider the following statements with respect to Intensive Subsistence Farming:
1. It is mainly carried in areas of sparse population.
2. It is mainly practised in American Prairies.
3. It is largely dominated by Tea and Cotton crops.
Which of the above statements is/are Incorrect?
 A: 1 and 2 only
 B: 2 and 3 only
 C: 1 and 3 only
 D: All of the above

Which is NOT a correct match?
 A: 1
 B: 2
 C: 3
 D: 4

Which type of language variation often occurs due to differences in accent and regional vocabulary?
 A: Standard Language B: Language Family C: Dialect D: Language Group

Match List - I with List - II.

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: A - I, B - III, C - II, D - IV
 B: A - I, B - III, C - IV, D - II
 C: A - III, B - I, C - II, D - IV
 D: A - III, B - I, C - IV, D - II

Choose the INCORRECT statement related to monsoon.  A: The Southwest Monsoon winds blow over the warm oceans, gather moisture and bring widespread rainfall over the mainland of India. B: The intensity and position of the high-pressure area, east of Madagascar, affects the Indian Monsoon. C: The difference in pressure over Tahiti (Pacific Ocean), and Darwin in northern Australia (Indian Ocean) is computed to predict the intensity of the monsoons. D: The western cyclonic disturbances occur due to withdrawal or the retreat of the monsoon.

Which are the largest Bauxite and Mica producing States in India?
 A: (1)
 B: (2)
 C: (3)
 D: (4)
Which of the following irrigation projects is a joint project of the states of Rajasthan, Punjab and Haryana?  A: Indira Gandhi Canal B: Mahi Bajaj Sagar  C: Vyasa Project D: narmada canal
In 1796, the nebular hypothesis about the origin of the Earth was given by ________. A: Laplace B: Jean Brunhes C: R S. Morgan D: T.C. Chamberlin

Arrange in correct descending order (% composition) of permanent gases of the atmosphere?
 A: Argon > Carbon dioxide > Neon > Helium
 B: Carbon dioxide > Argon > Neon > Helium
 C: Carbon dioxide > Argon > Helium > Neon
 D: Argon > Carbon dioxide > Helium > Neon

Kuroshio is a warm ocean current which runs from
 A: Philippines to Japan
 B: Indonesia to Philippines
 C: Japan to China
 D: Sri Lanka to Indonesia

The functioning of ecosystem depends on _________.
A. Energy flow
B. Nutrient cycles
C. Biogeochemical cycles
D. Tidal energy
Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:  
 A: A and D only  B: B and D only  C: A, Band D only   D: A, B and C only
The Green Revolution delivered only a moderate agricultural growth, mainly a rise in:   A: Rice Production B: Oil seeds Production C: Wheat Production D: Lientils Production

Which state has the highest population growth according to the 2011 census?
 A: Bihar
 B: Uttar Pradesh
 C: Meghalaya
 D: Madhya Pradesh
The satellite commonly used for remote sensing and meteorology is- A: Geostationary satellite B: Polar satellite C: Ground Satellite D: All of the above

Given below are two statements:
Statement I: Non-parametric tests are often more efficient compared to tests of significance or parametric tests.
Statement II: Non-parametric tests can be applicable to ordinal or nominal scale data.
In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true.
 B: Both Statement I and Statement II are false.
 C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false.
 D: Statement I is false but Statement II is true.

The Hadley cell is formed between which two air pressure belts?
 A: Equatorial low pressure belt and sub- tropical high pressure belt
 B: Sub-tropical high pressure belt and sub-polar low pressure belt
 C: Sub-polar low pressure belt and polar high pressure belt
 D: Sub-tropical high pressure belt and polar high pressure belt
Which one of the following has the highest percentage of urban population? A: Oman B: Qatar C: Saudi Arabia D: Syria

What are the factors influencing the distribution of the population?
(1) Availability of water and climate
(2) Urbanization and industrialization
(3) Mineral resources
(4) Social factors
 A: 1, 2 and 3 B: 2, 3 and 4 C: 1, 3 and 4 D: All of the above
Which of the following countries has the most rapidly aging population in the history of the world? A: Japan B: Germany C: Italy D: Spain

Regarding the Demographic Transition Theory, consider the following statements:
1. The first stage has high fertility and high mortality because people reproduce more to compensate for the deaths due to epidemics and variable food supply.
2. Fertility remains low at the beginning of the second stage but it increases with time which is accompanied by an increased mortality rate.
3. In the last stage, both fertility and mortality increase considerably which leads to the population being either stable or growing slowly.
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
 A: 1 only
 B: 2 and 3 only
 C: 2 only
 D: 1 and 3 only

Which of the following steps can the government take to move towards sustainable use of natural resources? A: Making the study of environmental science compulsory B: Ban on firecrackers during festivals C: Restrictions on travel by airplanes D: Creation of metro and bus services

Which one of the following is correct classification of resources according to availability? A: Ubiquities, Commonalities, Rarities B: Unused, Potential, Latent C: Sustainable, Improvable, Non Improvable D: Unused, Potential, Rarities

Imaginary lines joining equal ___________ is known as isohyets
 A: height
 B: humidity
 C: rainfall
 D: pressure

For the following three types of maps, identify the correct descending order based on the scale starting from the largest map scale : A: Atlas map - Topographical map - Cadastral map B: Cadastral map - Topographical map - Atlas map C: Cadastral map - Atlas map - Topographical map D: Topographical map - Atlas map - Cadastral map

Which of the following evidence supports the Continental Drift Theory proposed by Alfred Wegner?
1. Jig Saw fit of African and South American coastlines.
2. The occurrence of rich placer deposits of Gold on the Ghana coast.
 A: 1 only B: neither 1 nor 2 C: 2 only D: Both 1 and 2
Which is not a correct match?  A: Karst Landforms - Looped bar B: Fluvial Landforms - Natural Levees C: Glacial Landforms - Nunatak D: Arid Landforms - Ripple marks
If incoming short-wave solar radiation is 100 per cent, then the heat budget of the atmosphere comprises ____ of solar radiation.  A: 61 percent  B: 34 percent  C: 20 percent  D: 48 percent

Thornthwaite did NOT use _______ in the criteria of his first scheme of classification of climates.
 A: summer concentration of thermal efficiency
 B: percipitation effectiveness
 C: seasonal distribution of precipitation.
 D: thermal efficiency
'Polar Frontal Theory' is associated with -  A: Development of coral reefs B: Origin of temperate cyclones  C: Origin of trade winds D: Origin of tropical cyclones
Out of total population of 121 crore. what was the level (percentage) of urbanization in 2011, census of India? A: 33.15% B: 32.15% C: 30.15% D: 31.15%

Boundaries between India and Pakistan & India and Bangladesh belong to which one of the following types?
 A: Antecedent Boundaries
 B: Subsequent Boundaries
 C: Super imposed Boundaries
 D: Relict Boundaries
Structuralism is derived from the works of A: Octovia piz B: Jurgen Habermes C: David Holmes D: Ferdinand de Saussure

All the given statements regarding maize cultivation are correct except:
 A: It is very sensitive to excess water.
 B: It requires a field having higher salinity.
 C: A fertile, well-drained loamy soil is best for it.
 D: It is essentially a warm and humid season crop.
Daly was a part of _______. A: voyage in Challenger B: voyage to Hawaii island C: voyage in Beagle D: voyage in Tahiti

"Race is a valid biological concept, it is a group united by heredity, a breed or genetic strain or sub species, it is not a valid socio-cultural concept". Who gave this statement ? A: G. Taylor B: Arthur Keith C: Kroeber D: B. S. Guha
Seamount with flat tops are called: A: Atoll B: Submarine canyon C: Guyots D: Mid Oceanic Ridge
The highest proportion of the total water used in the country is in which one of the following sectors? A: Irrigation B: Domestic use C: Industries D: None of the above
_______ is the leading country in the world in marine fisheries in 2020 as per the FAO report 2022. A: Peru B: Japan C: India D: China

Match List-I with List-II

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) - (IV), (B) - (III), (C) - (II), (D) - (I)
 B: (A) - (IV), (B) - (II), (C) - (I), (D) - (III)
 C: (A) - (IV), (B) - (II), (C) - (III), (D) - (I)
 D: (A) - (I), (B) - (III), (C) - (II), (D) - (IV)

(A). Karnataka
(B). Uttar Pradesh
(C). Mizoram
(D). Rajasthan
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (C), (A), (D), (B). B: (A), (B), (C), (D). C: (B), (A), (D), (C). D: (C), (B), (D), (A).

Match List-I with List-II

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) - (II), (B) - (I), (C) - (IV), (D) - (III)
 B: (A) - (I), (B) - (III), (C) - (II), (D) - (IV)
 C: (A) - (I), (B) - (II), (C) - (IV), (D) - (III)
 D: (A) - (III), (B) - (IV), (C) - (I), (D) - (II)

Identify the correct statements
(A). The direction of movement of particles in P-waves is to and fro.
(B). The path followed by P-waves through interior of earth is convex.
(C). The motion of particles in Rayleigh waves is in elliptical orbit in the plane of propogation.
(D). S-waves can pass through solid and liquid.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (B) and (D) only. B: (B) and (C) only. C: (A), (B), and (D) only D: (A) and (C) only.

Match List-I with List-II

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) - (IV), (B) - (I), (C) - (III), (D) - (II)
 B: (A) - (I), (B) - (III), (C) - (II), (D) - (IV)
 C: (A) - (II), (B) - (I), (C) - (IV), (D) - (III)
 D: (A) - (I), (B) - (IV), (C) - (II), (D) - (III)
The ratio of Absolute humidity to humidity capacity of an air parcel at certain temperature is known as ________ A: Absolute Humidity B: Relative Humidity C: Specific Humidity D: Mixing Ratio
The area in which the film is held flat during an exposure is called the ______. A: Focal Plane B: Focal Length C: Local Datum D: Field of view

Arrange the following cities in descending order on the basis of variability of rainfall when mean and standard deviation are given.
(A). Mean = 50 cm; standard deviation = 5 cm
(B). Mean = 150 cm; standard deviation = 10 cm
(C). Mean = 20 cm; standard deviation = 5 cm
(D). Mean = 250 cm; standard deviation = 20 cm
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (B), (A), (C), (D). B: (B), (C), (A), (D). C: (D), (C), (A), (B). D: (C), (A), (D), (B).

Identify the correct statements about aerial photo interpretation.
(A). In the aerial photograph the railway line appears as a dark thin line whereas the concrete highway appears in a bright tone.
(B). Texture helps in identification of areas with vegetative cover, crops, pastures, etc.
(C). Shape aids in the visualising of the relief dimensions.
(D). The pattern of drainage network in an aerial photograph gives a definite indication of the underlying rock type, its structure and also the characteristics of soil etc.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A), (C) and (D) only. B: (A) and (D) only. C: (C) and (D) only. D: (A), (B) and (D) only.

In which State of India the highest percent (2011) of urban population?
 A: Goa
 B: Maharashtra
 C: Kerala
 D: Mizoram

Which coal is low-grade, brown and soft with high moisture content?
 A: Metallurgical
 B: Lignite
 C: Bituminous
 D: Anthracite

Match List I with List II

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: A - IV, B - III, C - I, D - II
 B: A - IV, B - II, C - III, D - I
 C: A - II, B - III, C - IV, D - I
 D: A - II, B - IV, C - III, D - I

Which of the following principles does not belong to logical positivism?
 A: Principle of Causation
 B: Structuralism
 C: Behaviourism
 D: Functionalism

 A: T.S. Kuhn
 B: William Kirk
 C: C.R. Darwin
 D: A.G. Tansley

 A: Because both death rate and birth rate are high
 B: Because both death rate and birth rate are low
 C: Because such countries usually have strict government policies related to population growth
 D: Because people migrate from underdeveloped countries
"Hyper markets" are shopping centres located A: Near the CBD B: Near rail - road junction C: Out of town D: Near hospitals

Which one among the following focuses the expeditious disposal of the cases pertaining to environmental issues?
 A: Compensatory Afforestation Act
 B: Forest Conservation Act
 C: Environmental Protection Act
 D: The National Green Tribunal

 A: Convergence of two Continental Plates
 B: Convergence of two Oceanic Plates
 C: Convergence of one Continental and an Oceanic Plate
 D: Convergence of two Continental Plates and two Oceanic Plates

List I mentions the heat budget of shortwave radiation on Earth, while List II gives the per cent amount.
Match List-I with List-II:

Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A) - (I), (B) - (IV), (C) - (III), (D) - (II)
 B: (A) - (II), (B) - (III), (C) - (I), (D) - (IV)
 C: (A) - (III), (B) - (I), (C) - (IV), (D) - (II)

How many of the above pairs are correctly matched?
 A: Only one
 B: Only two
 C: Only three
 D: All four

 A: fringing reef
 B: barrier reef
 C: atoll
 D: debris of dead coral reef

Which one the following does not fall in the areas of tropical deciduous forest biomes? A: The Neotropics mainly West Indies B: Indo-Malaysian zone mainly in south and south-east Asia except equatorial evergreen rainforest areas C: Eastern Africa and northern Australia D: North America mainly South-west America

Which one of the following is not correctly matched with respect to dam & river?
 A: Dharoi Dam - Mahi River
 B: Ukai Project - Tapi River
 C: Nathpa Jhakri - Sutlej
 D: Nagarjuna Sagar - Krishna River

What is the name of the physical feature that is the longitudinal valley lying between the Lesser Himalayas and the Siwalik in India?
 A: Terai
 B: Doab
 C: Duns
 D: Bhabhar

According the Census of India 2011, which group of states has the least urban population?
 A: Himachal Pradesh and Bihar
 B: Uttar Pradesh and Bihar
 C: Madhya Pradesh and Bihar
 D: Himachal Pradesh and Meghalaya
The Poisson distribution has A: one parameter B: two parameters C: three parameters D: four parameters

Which of the following is NOT an example of zonal soil ?
 A: Alluvial soil
 B: Prairy soil
 C: Laterite soil
 D: Chernozem

Papua New Guinea is considered part of which one of the following island group?
 A: Micronesia
 B: Melanesia
 C: Polynesia
 D: Hawaii Island chain

Which of the following statements are correct regarding welfare geography?
A. It was revolutionary in theory and revolutionary in practice.
B. The basis of welfare approach is on "who gets what, where and how.”
C. It was based on positivism.
D. It is a pragmatic approach to overcome the problems of inequalities.
Choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below:  
 A: A and B only  B: B and C only  C: B and D only  D: C and D only
Metamorphosis of _______ rock forms slate.  A: Sandstone B: Shale C: Limestone  D: Granite
Water pollutants that are responsible for Eutrophication are: A: polychorinated biphenyls B: fertilizers contain phosphates C: sulphates & nitrates D: organic wastes

Identify correct statements with reference to urbanisation.
(A). Level of urbanisation in India is more than the world average.
(B). At world level share of rural population is only 5 percent more than urban population.
(C). In the total urban population of the world the share of Less Developed Countries is more than the share of More Developed Countries.
(D). The level of urbanisation in South America is more than in Europe.
Choose the correct answer from the options given below:
 A: (A), (B) and (D) only. B: (A), (B) and (C) only. C: (C) and (D) only. D: (B) and (D) only.

Kashmir valley lies between which of the following two ranges? A: Karakoram and Ladakh range B: Ladakh and Zaskar range C: Great Himalayan range and Pir Panjal range D: Pir panjal range and Shivalik range

As warm air cools, its relative humidity
 A: Increases
 B: Decreases
 C: Remains same
 D: Depends on wet bulb temperature

Consider the following with respect to Indias merchandise trade
	In the world, Indias merchandise export is largest to U.A.E followed by China
	In Asia, Indias merchandise export is largest to U.A.E followed by China
	In Asia, Indias merchandise import is largest from China followed by U.A.E
Select the correct code answer using the code below
